meanings.definition: The power or authority to command or control
meanings.sent1: The king's imperiums allowed him to make important decisions for the kingdom.
meanings.sent2: The president's imperiums extended over the entire nation.
meanings.sent3: The imperiums of the teacher in the classroom kept the students in line.
meanings.sent4: Her imperiums over the household were unquestioned, like a queen ruling her realm.
meanings.sent5: The imperiums of the CEO were so vast that it seemed like he controlled the entire industry.

meanings.definition: A territory over which dominion is exercised
meanings.sent1: The ancient empire's imperiums covered vast lands and seas.
meanings.sent2: The conqueror's imperiums stretched from the mountains to the coast.
meanings.sent3: The imperiums of the forest creatures extended deep into the woods.
meanings.sent4: His imperiums over the neighborhood made him feel like a ruler of a small kingdom.
meanings.sent5: The imperiums of the desert tribes were marked by their nomadic lifestyle.

meanings.definition: The right to command or control troops
meanings.sent1: The general's imperiums allowed him to lead the army into battle.
meanings.sent2: The commander's imperiums were respected by all soldiers under his command.
meanings.sent3: The imperiums of the drill sergeant made even the toughest recruits obey.
meanings.sent4: Her imperiums over the military unit were as strong as iron discipline.
meanings.sent5: The imperiums of the captain were evident in the precise maneuvers of the soldiers.
